args:
With Sabnock defeated, the recital can beginâ€”
but Elias is unable to take part in it. He has
accepted his changing voice, however, and
vows to continue his singing. He and Lucretia
then croon a duet that rings in the prince's
ears long after the final note ends.
You did. You found the courage to\novercome the darkness that was\ninside your own heart.
You were amazing, Elias. Thank you.
I'm not confused anymoreâ€”and the\njealous, bitter person I once was is\ngone for good now.
...Well, it took a lot longer than we\nthought, but I'm really looking forward\nto this recital.
Everyone seems very happy. It's a fitting\nemotion for such a moment.
Hey, wait a sec. All the choir folks are\nlined up, but I don't see Elias anywhere.
Aw man, you're right! You don't think it's\nall that voice stuff, do you?
He may have overcome his own darkness,\nbut that doesn't mean his old voice will\never return.
Oh wow, Elias! Your voice! It's so...
Yes. But my throat is in bad shape,\nso I've had to bow out of tonight's\nperformance.
But this was to be your final recital!
With the choir, yes. But there are still\nmany places where I can perform as\na singer.
I've no intention of abandoning my singing\ncareer, even if it's going to occur at a\ndifferent pitch.
It may not be the ethereal sound some\nhave come to expect of me, but it will still\nbe enough to make an audience happy.
For sure! I remember when you were just\nsome punk kid, and now look at ya!
But if you aren't performing in the recital,\nwho's gonna sing the solo?
Heh. Have a look for yourself.\nThe performance is about to begin.
It's so pure and beautiful...\nIt's like it might shatter at any moment.
And because the miracle of this\nmoment is fleeting, that makes\nit all the more touching.
Shut up, guys! The solo's starting!
Wait, PIA?! That jittery little kid's gonna\nsing the big solo?!
She won the part fair and square after\nI bowed out. Apparently she's been\npracticing non-stop.
She's still not quite as good as me,\nbut for a first-time soloist, she shows\ntremendous promise.
Drop the cocky attitude already, pal!\nShe's super good and you know it!
It seems Elias is not the only one who\nhas grown up recently.
...I'm going to step out for a minute.
Hmm. I'm going to go check on him.\nThe rest of you should stay here and\nenjoy the show.
Oh, hello. What are you three doing here?
We saw Elias leave and were concerned.
Although it looks like that concern was\nmisplaced. Look over there.
It's not the beautiful soprano voice that\nI'm used to, and yet it echoes in my heart\nall the same.
It's like he's broken free of his troubles!
I can't wait to see what comes next in\nhis life.
Music continues through easy times and\nhard; through weakness and strength.
So long as we have dreams,\nwe have music.
And as a fellow musician, I cannot allow\nmyself to fall behind him.
Will you all excuse me for a moment?\nI think his song needs a second voice.
You've a beautiful singing voice, sir.\nMight I accompany you?
I feel like I also learned something\nfrom Elias.
While there may be a bright future at the\nend of all our worries and pain, it's not\none that will come on its own.
You have to choose it and fight for it.\nYou have to MAKE that future your own.
